<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/31/president-trump-expected-order-bytedance-divest-stake-tiktok?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Live Every Day on TikTok Like It's Your Last
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="TikTok " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMDczL3Rpa3Rvay5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s been rumored for months, but late last night President Trump actually <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-tiktok-bytedance/trump-says-will-ban-tiktok-amid-pressure-on-chinese-owner-to-sell-idUSKCN24W2PN?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said the words</a> out loud:</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">“As far as TikTok is concerned we’re banning them from the United States,” he told reporters on Air Force One. “I will sign the document tomorrow,” aka today. It’s not clear what authority the president will use to ban one of the world’s most popular social media apps from operating in the U.S., but Bloomberg <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">says</a> it'll be through executive order or under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">This is pretty wild </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">TikTok had the best quarter for any app ever<em> </em>in Q1 as the pandemic swept across the world and kept people at home. It has up to 80 million active monthly users in the U.S. and infiltrated the highest rungs of popular culture. If you’re looking for the <a href="https://www.billboard.com/articles/events/year-in-music-2019/8546455/tiktok-hit-making-meme-culture-2020-outlook?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">top songs</a> in the country...better start your search on TikTok. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>But how do we </span><span><em>really</em></span><span> know TikTok is doing something right? Zuck’s </span><span><a href="https://techcrunch.com/2020/07/16/instagram-confirms-its-tiktok-rival-reels-will-launch-in-the-us-in-early-august/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">trying to copy it</a></span><span>. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">So why ban TikTok? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The app is caught up in the epic tug-of-war between the U.S. and China. It’s owned by the Chinese tech firm ByteDance, an arrangement U.S. government officials say presents grave national security risks. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo has </span><span><a href="https://link.morningbrew.com/click/21073876.0/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cudGhldmVyZ2UuY29tLzIwMjAvNy8zMS8yMTM0OTg0MS90cnVtcC10aWt0b2stYnl0ZWRhbmNlLXNlbGwtb3duZXJzaGlwLWNoaW5hLXVzLW9yZGVyLWJhbj91dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/5f10d6a212c71038741b0759Bdd92e7c9?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">claimed</a></span><span> data from American TikTok users could be handed over to the Chinese government if it demands it.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>TikTok has denied these allegations, and recently hired an American CEO, former Disney exec Kevin Mayer, to show it’s committed to the stars and stripes.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Earlier on Friday, reports swirled that Microsoft was in talks to buy TikTok’s U.S. operations to calm the government’s national security fears. Trump said he did not support that kind of deal. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the consequences of a TikTok ban are large enough to make your head spin, affecting everything from geopolitics to the advertising industry. Let’s see what happens today.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PHARMA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/31/us-government-pledges-21-billion-sanofi-glaxosmithklines-vaccine-candidate?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Operation Warp Speed Continues to Warp Speed
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Spaceballs GIF " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=364 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/12haGO61oFZ28w/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Spaceballs GIF " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/12haGO61oFZ28w/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, a potential coronavirus vaccine from drugmakers Sanofi and GlaxoSmithKline became the sixth candidate to join Operation Warp Speed. The two companies inked a <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/07/31/us-agrees-to-pay-sanofi-and-gsk-2point1-billion-for-100-million-doses-of-coronavirus-vaccine.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$2.1 billion deal</a> with the U.S. government to advance clinical trials and development.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Quick refresher</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Operation Warp Speed is the name of the government's all-out blitz to develop a vaccine by the end of this year. The fund has made sizable investments in five separate prospects, but the $2.1 billion it’s sending Sanofi/GSK’s way is the biggest check so far.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Bigger doesn’t mean better:</strong></span><span> Sanofi/GSK's candidate hasn't advanced beyond </span><span><a href="https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2020/07/31/897701128/u-s-reaches-2-1-billion-deal-with-sanofi-and-glaxosmithkline-for-coronavirus-vac?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">preclinical trials</a></span><span>, remaining well behind other leading candidates who are already in Phase 3 (typically the last step before FDA approval). </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>So far, the vaccine development process has been a lot like playing darts blindfolded—the more you throw, the better chance you have of hitting the bullseye. </p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CYBERSECURITY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/31/florida-teen-accused-mastermind-twitter-hack-arrested-tampa?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Florida Man, Meet Florida Teen
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Three teenagers, including a 17-year-old from Tampa, FL, suspected of being the “mastermind” behind last month’s massive Twitter hack, were <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/7/31/21349920/twitter-hack-arrest-florida-teen-fbi-irs-secret-service?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">arrested</a> yesterday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The suspected leader is being charged with more than 30 felony counts, including communications fraud, identity theft, and access to a computer without authority. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>On July 15, Twitter <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/16/massive-hack-targets-twitters-prominent-users?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">descended into chaos</a> when hackers targeted 130 accounts of some of the most prominent people in the world—such as Bill Gates, Elon Musk, and Joe Biden—and promoted a cryptocurrency scam that netted the hackers more than $100,000. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Some expressed relief that a little bitcoin was all the perpetrators were after. Twitter has become the de facto platform for world leaders to communicate policy, so who knows what would’ve happened if the hackers had more Joker-like intentions. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In a statement, Twitter said, “We appreciate the swift actions of law enforcement in this investigation and will continue to cooperate as the case progresses.” It also released a <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/7/30/21348974/twitter-spear-phishing-attack-bitcoin-scam?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fuller assessment</a> of what it believed happened that day, and the steps it’s taking to prevent another attack.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">

<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What seeds? <em>Those </em>seeds. The seeds everyone is talking about.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In recent weeks, people in dozens of U.S. states and in some countries abroad have received packages of seeds they did not order. What we know about the seeds:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The USDA has </span><span><a href="https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2020/07/31/usda-identifies-some-seeds-appear-sent-china/5555404002/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">identified</a></span><span> 14 different kinds, including flowering plants (morning glory), veggies (cabbage), and herbs (lavender).</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>They appear to be coming from China. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Get a package? DON’T PLANT THE SEEDS (you might be introducing an invasive species). The government says you should contact your state plant regulatory official instead. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’s going on? </strong>The USDA thinks the unsolicited seed deliveries are part of what’s known as a “brushing” scam in e-commerce. A seller on a platform like Amazon or Etsy will send out packages with items of little value, which allows them to forge positive reviews and boost sales. So...maybe a topic for an HBS case study rather than a Stephen King novel.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>This bizarre episode highlights the importance of positive reviews to online sellers. In fact, a whole <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/mystery-seeds-raise-questions-about-online-sales-tactics-in-china-11596215806?mod=hp_lista_pos2&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cottage industry</a> has sprung up in China to help merchants get better reviews.</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RELIGION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/31/hajj-looks-lot-different-year?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">

That Was Then...
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<img alt="Hajj in 2016" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xOTUyL2hhampfaW5fMjAxNi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>AHMAD GHARABLI/AFP via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;">Muslim pilgrims crowd around the Kaaba, Islam's holiest site, in 2016. They are participating in <a href="https://www.bbc.co.uk/newsround/24566691?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the Hajj</a>, an annual pilgrimage of millions of Muslims to Mecca, Saudi Arabia, and one of the world's largest religious gatherings. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0;line-height: 22px;">This is now...</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xOTUzL2hhampfMjAyMC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24ifQ==" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="" data-reactroot=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;"><small> <em>STR/AFP via Getty Images</em> </small></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Far fewer pilgrims crowded around the Kaaba this week. Saudi Arabia is not allowing any outsiders to come into the kingdom for the Hajj this year due to the pandemic, and those who are participating are subject to <a href="https://apnews.com/42c9f653660dcb4085018b9cb1072311?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">strict restrictions</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That's where <a href="https://apnews.com/74794ac480af43feb55b75ad0bb60fa2?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">high tech</a> comes in. Pilgrims were given wristbands to measure their movements upon entering Mecca, and they'll be subject to numerous thermal scanners for temperature monitoring.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"></p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

SATURDAY HEADLINES
</h3>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On this week's edition of Saturday Headlines, we’re talking misinformation—something Saturday Headlines knows all about. Three of these headlines are real, but one is fake. Can you figure out which is which? </p>

A lot of that has to do with Big Tech, which has gone full Beast Mode during this pandemic. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nSOCIAL MEDIA \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/31/president-trump-expected-order-bytedance-divest-stake-tiktok?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nLive Every Day on TikTok Like It's Your Last\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"TikTok \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMDczL3Rpa3Rvay5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s been rumored for months, but late last night President Trump actually \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-tiktok-bytedance/trump-says-will-ban-tiktok-amid-pressure-on-chinese-owner-to-sell-idUSKCN24W2PN?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid the words\u003c/a\u003e out loud:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e“As far as TikTok is concerned we’re banning them from the United States,” he told reporters on Air Force One. “I will sign the document tomorrow,” aka today. It’s not clear what authority the president will use to ban one of the world’s most popular social media apps from operating in the U.S., but Bloomberg \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esays\u003c/a\u003e it'll be through executive order or under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThis is pretty wild \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTikTok had the best quarter for any app ever\u003cem\u003e \u003c/em\u003ein Q1 as the pandemic swept across the world and kept people at home. It has up to 80 million active monthly users in the U.S. and infiltrated the highest rungs of popular culture. If you’re looking for the \u003ca href=\"https://www.billboard.com/articles/events/year-in-music-2019/8546455/tiktok-hit-making-meme-culture-2020-outlook?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etop songs\u003c/a\u003e in the country...better start your search on TikTok. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eBut how do we \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003ereally\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e know TikTok is doing something right? Zuck’s \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2020/07/16/instagram-confirms-its-tiktok-rival-reels-will-launch-in-the-us-in-early-august/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etrying to copy it\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSo why ban TikTok? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe app is caught up in the epic tug-of-war between the U.S. and China. It’s owned by the Chinese tech firm ByteDance, an arrangement U.S. government officials say presents grave national security risks. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eU.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo has \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://link.morningbrew.com/click/21073876.0/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cudGhldmVyZ2UuY29tLzIwMjAvNy8zMS8yMTM0OTg0MS90cnVtcC10aWt0b2stYnl0ZWRhbmNlLXNlbGwtb3duZXJzaGlwLWNoaW5hLXVzLW9yZGVyLWJhbj91dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/5f10d6a212c71038741b0759Bdd92e7c9?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eclaimed\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e data from American TikTok users could be handed over to the Chinese government if it demands it.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTikTok has denied these allegations, and recently hired an American CEO, former Disney exec Kevin Mayer, to show it’s committed to the stars and stripes.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEarlier on Friday, reports swirled that Microsoft was in talks to buy TikTok’s U.S. operations to calm the government’s national security fears. Trump said he did not support that kind of deal. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe consequences of a TikTok ban are large enough to make your head spin, affecting everything from geopolitics to the advertising industry. Let’s see what happens today.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, a potential coronavirus vaccine from drugmakers Sanofi and GlaxoSmithKline became the sixth candidate to join Operation Warp Speed. The two companies inked a \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/07/31/us-agrees-to-pay-sanofi-and-gsk-2point1-billion-for-100-million-doses-of-coronavirus-vaccine.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$2.1 billion deal\u003c/a\u003e with the U.S. government to advance clinical trials and development.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eQuick refresher\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOperation Warp Speed is the name of the government's all-out blitz to develop a vaccine by the end of this year. The fund has made sizable investments in five separate prospects, but the $2.1 billion it’s sending Sanofi/GSK’s way is the biggest check so far.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBigger doesn’t mean better:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Sanofi/GSK's candidate hasn't advanced beyond \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2020/07/31/897701128/u-s-reaches-2-1-billion-deal-with-sanofi-and-glaxosmithkline-for-coronavirus-vac?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epreclinical trials\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, remaining well behind other leading candidates who are already in Phase 3 (typically the last step before FDA approval). \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eSo far, the vaccine development process has been a lot like playing style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThree teenagers, including a 17-year-old from Tampa, FL, suspected of being the “mastermind” behind last month’s massive Twitter hack, were \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/7/31/21349920/twitter-hack-arrest-florida-teen-fbi-irs-secret-service?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003earrested\u003c/a\u003e yesterday. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe suspected leader is being charged with more than 30 felony counts, including communications fraud, identity theft, and access to a computer without authority. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eOn July 15, Twitter \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/16/massive-hack-targets-twitters-prominent-users?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edescended into chaos\u003c/a\u003e when hackers targeted 130 accounts of some of the most prominent people in the world—such as Bill Gates, Elon Musk, and Joe Biden—and promoted a cryptocurrency scam that netted the hackers more than $100,000. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSome expressed relief that a little bitcoin was all the perpetrators were after. Twitter has become the de facto platform for world leaders to communicate policy, so who knows what would’ve happened if the hackers had more Joker-like intentions. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn a statement, Twitter said, “We appreciate the swift actions of law enforcement in this investigation and will continue to cooperate as the case progresses.” It also released a \u003ca style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhat seeds? \u003cem\u003eThose \u003c/em\u003eseeds. The seeds everyone is talking about.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn recent weeks, people in dozens of U.S. states and in some countries abroad have received packages of seeds they did not order. What we know about the seeds:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe USDA has \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2020/07/31/usda-identifies-some-seeds-appear-sent-china/5555404002/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eidentified\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e 14 different kinds, including flowering plants (morning glory), veggies (cabbage), and herbs (lavender).\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThey appear to be coming from China. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGet a package? DON’T PLANT THE SEEDS (you might be introducing an invasive species). The government says you should contact your state plant regulatory official instead. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat’s going on? \u003c/strong\u003eThe USDA thinks the unsolicited seed deliveries are part of what’s known as a “brushing” scam in e-commerce. A seller on a platform like Amazon or Etsy will send out packages with items of little value, which allows them to forge positive reviews and boost sales. So...maybe a topic for an HBS case study rather than a Stephen King novel.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThis bizarre episode highlights the importance of positive reviews to online sellers. In fact, a whole \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/mystery-seeds-raise-questions-about-online-sales-tactics-in-china-11596215806?mod=hp_lista_pos2\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecottage industry\u003c/a\u003e has sprung up in China to help merchants get better reviews.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F07%2F31%2Fmysterious-seeds-appear-part-ecommerce-scam\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; Saudi Arabia is not allowing any outsiders to come into the kingdom for the Hajj this year due to the pandemic, and those who are participating are subject to \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/42c9f653660dcb4085018b9cb1072311?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estrict restrictions\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat's where \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/74794ac480af43feb55b75ad0bb60fa2?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehigh tech\u003c/a\u003e comes in.
